com.cloudpos

Interface Device

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CashDrawerDevice, FingerprintDevice, HSMDevice, LEDDevice, MSRDevice, PINPadDevice, PrinterDevice, RFCardReaderDevice, SecondaryDisplayDevice, SerialPortDevice, SignatureDevice, SmartCardReaderDevice

    public interface Device
    The Device interface is the root for all device interfaces. It must b inherited by all device interfaces, and, ultimately, implemented by all concrete device classes.

    All the application use Device object to visit the devices in terminal. The device in the terminal is exclusive device,every device must be opened by one device object in the same time, if the device has different logic classification,each logic classification has been opened by one device object.

    The following is not allowed:

    • The device object has opened one logic classification device, and want to open the same or another logic classification device
    • The device object has opened one logic classification device, the other device object try to open the same logic classification device.

    But It permits that the different device object open a different logic classification device. Some special device can be opened sharable,for example security device.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancelRequest()
      Attempts to cancel a pending request.
      void close()
      Disconnect a device from the device object.
      long getFailCount()
      Gets the fail count of the three card, it can not be reset after get.
      long getUsageCount()
      Gets the three card using counts, it can not be reset after get.
      void open()
      Uses default logical ID to open the device for use.

    • Method Detail

      • open

        void open()
          throws DeviceException
        Uses default logical ID to open the device for use. After the POSTerminal has returned a reference to an unconnected device object, it must be connected to a concrete device through a call to the open method, operate the device only after the device is opened. The following two conditions is not allowed:
        • A device object has already opened the device,try to open the device again.
        • The different device object try to open the same device.
        But,if the device has already be closed,any device object can reopen the device.
        Throws:
        DeviceException

      • close

        void close()
           throws DeviceException
        Disconnect a device from the device object.

        If a continuous activity has been started by the device object, this activity is stopped. For example, the led object stop any continuous blink when it close.

        Once closed, the device object is no longer associated with any particular device, open() may then be used to reestablish a connection to either the former device object or a new device object.

        If there is a asynchronous request before close, then the asynchronous request will be cancelled.

        Throws:
        DeviceException - :
        • BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if the device is not opened.

      • cancelRequest

        void cancelRequest()
                   throws DeviceException
        Attempts to cancel a pending request.

        The exact performance of this command is operation-specific and falls into one of 2 categories.

        1. If the request method contains a timeout, the device object must successfully respond to cancelRequet and abort the operation.
        2. Depending on the particular implementation, however, other operations may not respond to cancelRequest.

        Throws:
        DeviceException - :
        • BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if the device is not open
        • NO_REQUEST_PENDING - if no request from this device object is pending

      • getUsageCount

        long getUsageCount()
        Gets the three card using counts, it can not be reset after get. The usage count of MSR is the swipe count; The usage count of IC card and the contactless card is the APDU transmit count.
        Returns:
        usageCount.

      • getFailCount

        long getFailCount()
        Gets the fail count of the three card, it can not be reset after get. The fail count of MSR is the fail count of swipe card; The fail count of IC card and the contactless card is fail count of the APDU transmit.
        Returns:
        failCount.
